News.Title: TV Vision Reports Q3 FY26 Loss of ₹601.36 Lakhs
News.Summary: TV Vision Limited posted a net loss of ₹601.36 lakhs for Q3 FY26, with revenue declining to ₹48.00 lakhs. The company also appointed Hemant Patil as CFO amid ongoing financial challenges.

News.Title: TV Vision Faces NCLT Petition for ₹4.90 Cr Debt
News.Summary: TV Vision Limited received copy of NCLT petition filed by Swami Films Entertainment under Section 9 of Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code for outstanding amount of ₹4.90 crores as operational creditor.

News.Title: TV Vision Limited Reports Quarterly Loss of Rs 515.57 Lakhs with Significant Going Concern Issues
News.Summary: TV Vision Limited announced unaudited financial results for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, showing a net loss of Rs 515.57 lakhs compared to Rs 526.05 lakhs in the same quarter last year. The company's income from operations was Rs 994.17 lakhs for the quarter. The company faces severe financial distress with negative total equity of Rs 12,489.12 lakhs on standalone basis and Rs 15,895.29 lakhs on consolidated basis. Auditors highlighted material uncertainty regarding the company's ability to continue as a going concern due to loan defaults, asset seizures by lenders, substantial losses, and current liabilities significantly exceeding current assets. The auditors issued a qualified opinion citing unprovided interest expenses of approximately Rs 346.70 lakhs on defaulted loans and potential impairment of business and commercial rights worth Rs 1,982.99 lakhs.

News.Title: TV Vision Limited CFO Santosh Thotam Resigns Due to Personal Reasons
News.Summary: TV Vision Limited announced that Chief Financial Officer Santosh Thotam has resigned from his position effective November 10, 2025, citing personal reasons. The company has accepted his resignation and will complete necessary formalities in due course. Thotam, who also served as Key Managerial Personnel, submitted his resignation letter on November 10, 2025, requesting relief from responsibilities at the close of business hours that day. The resignation was communicated to BSE Limited and National Stock Exchange of India Limited under regulatory compliance requirements.

News.Title: TV Vision Limited Appoints Ms. Aashi Neema as Company Secretary & Compliance Officer
News.Summary: TV Vision Limited's Board of Directors approved the appointment of Ms. Aashi Neema as Company Secretary & Compliance Officer effective October 17, 2025. The appointment was made on the recommendation of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee. Ms. Neema holds a Bachelor's degree in Commerce, a Bachelor in Law degree, and is a qualified Company Secretary with membership number A74936 from the Institute of Company Secretaries of India. She brings over 3 years of experience in secretarial matters, corporate laws, and SEBI regulations. She does not hold any shares in the company.

News.Title: TV Vision Limited Reports Quarterly Loss of ₹515.57 Lakhs, Reappoints Independent Director
News.Summary: TV Vision Limited reported a standalone net loss of ₹515.57 lakhs for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, compared to ₹700.40 lakhs loss in the same quarter last year. The company's total income decreased to ₹757.46 lakhs from ₹2,183.39 lakhs year-over-year. The Board approved the reappointment of Mr. Pritesh Rajgor as Independent Director for five years from November 24, 2025 to November 23, 2030, subject to shareholder approval. The company also appointed M/S. HRU & Associates as Secretarial Auditors for five years and shifted its registered office within the same building complex. The auditors highlighted material uncertainties regarding the company's going concern status due to loan defaults, non-performing asset classification by banks, and substantial losses.
